alert.note: Alert for Fairfax; Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 11:54PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maryland, including the following counties, Baltimore, Carroll, Howard and Montgomery and northern Virginia, including the following counties, Fairfax and Loudoun. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1154 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall. Several river gauges are rising quickly over the past 2-3 hours, and are expected to be near or exceed flood stage with the next round of rainfall. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia... Germantown... Rockville... Bethesda... Gaithersburg... Olney... Elkridge... Damascus... Lansdowne... Lowes Island... Poolesville... Historic Ellicott City... Ellicott City... Aspen Hill... Potomac... North Bethesda... Ashburn... Catonsville... Woodlawn... Randallstown... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
